page.title: 17Interesting People_1
page.content: {Mr Cooper}was born in 1913. He has lived in King's Worthy since 1954. He is a violin restorer and collector.His house, which was once a home for orphan girls, is called Eversley Cottage. he was taught to play the {violin}by a school teacher at the cost of six pence a week, the cost of the {instrument}being Â£1.50. He started learning at 12 years and at 21 took the Royal College of Music A.L.C.M. degree. He was trained as an engineer but in 1946 he began restoration of violins as a full occupation. He supplied violins for Hampshire schools until about 1960. Since retirement he looks after his own collection and those of personal friends from London Orchestras plus writing articles for the{'Strad'magazine.
